Problem:
Consider a complex function defined by \\( z(t) = e^{At}x \\) where x is a fixed complex number, and A is a complex constant. We investigate the behavior of \\( z(t) \\) after applying the integral transformation \\( w(t) = \\int_{0}^{t} z(s) ds \\).

If at time \\( t_1 \\), an additional function transformation \\( z(t) = z(t) + Ce^{Dt} \\) where C and D are constants is applied, does this intervention affect the value of \\( w(t) \\) at any T > t_1 compared to the original system governed by A?
Explanation: The introduction of a new additive transformation results in a modified function, changing the integrand from merely \\( z(t) = e^{At}x \\) to include \\( Ce^{Dt} \\). This intervention alters subsequent values of z(t) and thus impacts the integral \\( w(t) \\), deviating from the path had no intervention occurred.
